meanings: (정보나 지식을 갖추다) know, learn, have (good) knowledge (of), be familiar (with)
(이해하다) understand, know, see, follow, appreciate, (informal) get, make out
(깨닫다, 인지하다) realize, recognize, find, notice, sense, (formal) perceive, be aware (of), be conscious (of)
Knowing too much is a disease, Where ignorance is bliss, it is folly to be wise, Ignorance is the peace of life
Knowing too much is a disease, Where ignorance is bliss, it is folly to be wise, Ignorance is the peace of life
in the manner of one being unaware of something, unwittingly
It is not of one's concern
think one knows something, but actually does not know it

meanings.meaning: on the tip of your tongue

examples.korean: To my certain knowledge he was somewhere else at the time. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 내가 확실히 아는데 그는 그 시간에 어디 다른 데 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary

examples.korean: I know their address is here somewhere, but I can’t lay my hands on it right now. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들의 주소가 여기 어디 있다는 걸 아는데 지금은 찾을 수가 없어. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
